newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire says send refugees home, send food elsewhere.
newsitem.headline: Zaire says send refugees home, send food elsewhere.

text.p: Zaire's government, its army battling Tutsi rebels in the east, said on Saturday that over a million Hutu refugees from Rwanda and Burundi must be sent home.
Government spokesman Boguo Makeli told state television that the government had decided there should be a "forced and progressive expulsion" of the refugees from Zairean territory.
"In this connection, the government is keen to inform international opinion that if (protective) corridors must be created to settle the refugees, it's in Rwanda that they must be set up," he said.
He said that the government had henceforth invited the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees to stop sending food aid to Zaire and send it to Rwanda and Burundi instead.
Over a million Hutu refugees have lived in camps in eastern Zaire since 1994 when they fled Rwanda fearing reprisals or an upsurge in civil war after the genocide of Tutsis there.
Around 200,000 Burundian Hutu refugees are also in Zaire, having fled ethnic violence and war at home.
Tens of thousands of Zaireans have been uprooted by the latest fighting in the eastern refugee zone.
